channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13815] Procedure V2: Rollback of CreateTableProcedure should clear the table state
item.description:
If CreateTableProcedure rolls back, depending on the steps of the procedure, it might not change the table state to be 'Deleted' or just delete the table state.

In branch-1 and its child branches, the following exception will throw if the table is created again and the previous rollback is not clean:

2015-05-30 06:30:05,287 WARN [ProcedureExecutorThread-1] procedure.CreateTableProcedure: The table xyz does not exist in meta but has a znode. run hbck to fix inconsistencies.

In master branch, the table state is not checked during CreateTableProcedure#prepareCreate(), but we still need to make sure that the table state is in a consistent state.
item.summary: Procedure V2: Rollback of CreateTableProcedure should clear the table state

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Matteo Bertozzi I think the fix is to move the env.getMasterServices().getAssignmentManager().getTableStateManager().setDeletedTable(tableName); statement from deleteAssignmentState method to the deleteTableStates method in DeleteTableProcedure. This would solve the problem.

Simply moving the env.getMasterServices().getAssignmentManager().getTableStateManager().setDeletedTable(tableName); statement from deleteAssignmentState() method to the deleteTableStates() method in DeleteTableProcedure would not work - unfortunately, it breaks TruncateTableProcedure (who rely on deleteAssignmentState() to set table state).

I will fix the issue in the next patch.
